events.event_description: Texas recorded one of the lowest heat contents for dry natural gas in the US, averaging 1,018 Btu/cf, which was 1.7% below the national average of 1,036 Btu/cf.
events.citation: The heat content of dry natural gas delivered in Texas, which uses the largest volume of natural gas in the United States, was among the lowest nationwide in 2023, averaging 1,018 British thermal units per cubic foot (Btu/cf), or 1.7% below the national average (1,036 Btu/cf)

events.event_description: In the Permian Basin, ethane comprised 44% and propane 30% of the NGLs removed from natural gas streams.
events.citation: Ethane made up 44% of the NGL removed from the natural gas stream in the Permian Basin in 2023, and propane represented an additional 30%, according to our Petroleum Supply Annual.

events.event_description: The annual average ethane premium in the United States increased to $1.47/MMBtu, continuing a rising trend since 2019 when it was 79 cents per MMBtu.
events.citation: Excluding the severe impact of Winter Storm Uri on natural gas prices in early 2021, the annual average ethane premium in the United States has risen every year since 2019 from 79 cents per million British thermal units (MMBtu) to $1.47/MMBtu in 2023

events.event_description: Natural gas heat content has declined in North Dakota, West Virginia, and Pennsylvania due to increased ethane recovery.
events.citation: As more ethane has been recovered from natural gas flows because of the higher premium, the heat content of natural gas has fallen in recent years in several states including North Dakota, West Virginia, and Pennsylvania.
